verse:
कृषिर्भूवाचकः शब्दो नश्च निर्वृतिवाचकः ।
तयोरैक्यं परं ब्रह्म कृष्ण इत्यभिधीयते ॥
सच्चिदानन्दरूपाय कृष्णायाक्लिष्टकर्मणे।
नमो वेदान्तवेद्याय गुरवे बुद्धिसाक्षिणे॥

terms.शब्दो नश्च निर्वृतिवाचकः: The word "śabdaḥ" indicates a sound or word, while "naśca nirvṛtivācakaḥ" means it also denotes cessation or absence of something.
terms.तयोरैक्यं परं ब्रह्म कृष्ण इत्यभिधीयते: The unity or oneness of these two, agriculture and sound, is referred to as the supreme ultimate reality called "param brahma." This supreme reality is known as Krishna.
terms.सच्चिदानन्दरूपाय कृष्णायाक्लिष्टकर्मणे: Krishna is described as the embodiment of existence, consciousness, and bliss. He is also the one who performs actions effortlessly or without any difficulty.
terms.नमो वेदान्तवेद्याय गुरवे बुद्धिसाक्षिणे: Salutations to Krishna, who is known through the teachings of the Vedanta (the final part of the Vedic scriptures). He is the enlightened spiritual teacher who serves as the witness of intelligence or consciousness.

meaning: कृषि माने सत्ता, भू शब्द से, भू माने सत्ता, ण माने आनंद
